Experiment Method.Assay Method: cDNA cloning, cell culture and transfection and RT - PCR

Material used.Description: Human neuroblastoma M17 cells were cultured in Ham's F - 12 high glucose Dulbecco's modified Eagle's medium containing Eagle's Minimum Essential Medium supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum, L - glutamine, non - essential amino acids, sodium pyruvate and penicillin - streptomycin.

Readout description.Result Description: Increased HO - 1 expression suppresses intracellular a - synuclein levels. In cells transfected with 4, 8 and 12 μg HO - 1, the amounts of a - synuclein protein were, respectively, 16.1%, 39.5% and 47.3% lower relative to sham - transfected cells. A significant inverse correlation was observed between levels of transgenic HO - 1 and a - synuclein expression in these cells. HO - 1 over - expression does not reduce a - synuclein protein by reducing a - synuclein mRNA levels in M17 cells.

Myc - a - synuclein (A30P) displayed remarkable resistance to HO - 1 - induced proteosomal degradation. In cells transfected with 4, 8 and 12 μg of HO - 1, Myc - a - synuclein (A30P) levels were 95%, 105% and 110% respectively, of basal level observed in cells expressing Myc - a - synuclein (A30P) alone. Suppression of HO - 1 over - expression restored Myc - a - synuclein (WT) levels without affecting the concentration of Myc - a - synuclein (A30P).

In cells over - expressing HO - 1, the amount of A53T was 10.8% of those expressing mock construct. A53T mutation did not affect a - synuclein degradation significantly in HO - 1 over - expressing cells.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: The data were presented as mean ± SE. Statistical analyses were performed by one - way ANOVA followed by Newman - Keuls post hoc comparisons to assess significant main effects within groups. Statistical significance was set at p < 0.05.

Material used.Description: The HO - 1 gene was silenced in M17 cells essentially as described previously. siRNA motif against human HO - 1 was selected according to the rule of amino acid Asn - 19 targeting 106 - 126 nucleotides downstream of the start codon based on human HO - 1 cDNA sequence.

Readout description.Result Description: Reducing the expression of transgenic HO - 1 restored intracellular a - synuclein levels. HO - 1 over - expressing cells transfected with pSuper - Retro - siHO - 1 had a 72% decrease in HO - 1 over - expression with a concomitant three - fold increase in a - synuclein levels and a 3.5 - fold increase in tau levels.

Suppression of HO - 1 over - expression by siRNA in HO - 1 - transfected cells with Myc - A30P did not affect the concentration of Myc - a - synuclein (A30P) despite a 70% reduction in HO - 1 protein.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: The data were presented as mean ± SE. Statistical analyses were performed by one - way ANOVA followed by Newman - Keuls post hoc comparisons to assess significant main effects within groups. Statistical significance was set at p < 0.05.

Material used.Description: Cells were lysed in 20 mM Tris - HCl (pH 7.4) containing 0.25 M sucrose and protease inhibitor cocktail, sonicated on ice and centrifuged for 20 min at 4°C at 15 000 g. The reaction was initiated by adding an aliquot of the supernatant into the vial containing the rest of the components of the assay mixture.

Readout description.Result Description: Mock - transfected cells exhibited low levels of basal HO activity which was likely because of cellular HO - 2. HO - 1 - transfected cells displayed HO activity that was 2.8 - fold higher than basal levels. Cells transfected with HO - 1 and treated with SnMP exhibited similar amounts of HO - 1 protein but displayed HO activity only slightly above basal levels. Inhibition of HO activity by SnMP completely abrogated the decline in cellular a - synuclein levels accruing from over - expression of the HO - 1 transgene.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: The data were presented as mean ± SE. Statistical analyses were performed by one - way ANOVA followed by Newman - Keuls post hoc comparisons to assess significant main effects within groups. Statistical significance was set at p < 0.05.

Material used.Material Name: Cells transfected with different combinations of HO - 1, a - synuclein (WT) and a - synuclein (A30P)
Material used.Description: Cells transfected with different combinations of HO - 1, a - synuclein (WT) and a - synuclein (A30P) for 48 h were lysed in lysis buffer and centrifuged for 30 min at 15 000 g. The pellet was discarded and the protein concentration of each sample was adjusted to 1 mg/mL using lysis buffer.

Readout description.Result Description: HO - 1 significantly reduced aggregation of a - synuclein (WT) but not that of A30P. The relative amount of aggregated a - synuclein in cells over - expressing HO - 1 was 58% less than those expressing Myc - a - synuclein only. The relative amount of aggregated Myc - A30P, on the other hand, in cells over - expressing A30P and HO - 1 was 85% of that expressing Myc - A30P alone.

The A30P mutation did not interfere with HO activity in cells. The proportion of live cells in A30P transfected cultures was 95% of that computed in the WT - transfected cells. The resistance of A30P to HO - 1 - induced degradation is not because of excessive A30P protein expression.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: The data were presented as mean ± SE. Statistical analyses were performed by one - way ANOVA followed by Newman - Keuls post hoc comparisons to assess significant main effects within groups. Statistical significance was set at p < 0.05.

Material used.Material Name: Cells seeded in 96 - well plate and transfected with indicated plasmid DNA
Material used.Description: Cells seeded in 96 - well plate and transfected with indicated plasmid DNA were used for MTT cell survival assay. For immunoprecipitation, flag - tagged HO - 1 was immunoprecipitated from lysates of cells co - transfected with Flag - HO - 1 and Myc - a - synuclein (WT) or Myc - a - synuclein (A30P).

Readout description.Result Description: Neither a - synuclein (WT) nor A30P was detected in the immune complex from immunoprecipitation of HO - 1 and a - synuclein WT or A30P. The proportion of live cells in A30P transfected cultures was 95% of that computed in the WT - transfected cells in MTT cell survival assay.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: The data were presented as mean ± SE. Statistical analyses were performed by one - way ANOVA followed by Newman - Keuls post hoc comparisons to assess significant main effects within groups. Statistical significance was set at p < 0.05.
